titleproper.value: Guide to the Philip Howard Photographs<lb/> of the Racquet and Tennis Club<lb/>2018<lb/> <num>PR-374</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-11-19T14:42:59</date>

unittitle.value: Philip Howard photographs of the Racquet and Tennis Club

extent.value: (one portfolio and one book in an oversize box)

abstract.value: A portfolio of twenty-seven 16 x 20-inch archivally printed photographs by Philip Howard of the exterior and interiors of the Racquet and Tennis Club at 370 Park Avenue, a McKim, Mead & White-designed building completed in 1918. Also includes a book containing the same photographs and 14 additional views.

p.value: Photocopying undertaken by staff only. Limited to twenty exposures of stable, unbound material per day. (Researchers may not accrue unused copy amounts from previous days.)

This collection should be cited as the Philip Howard Photographs of the Racquet and Tennis Club, PR-374, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Gift of Philip Howard, 2018 (accession no. PPAC-2018-038). Credit line: Philip Howard.

Attorney, author, and photographer Philip K. Howard has been a member of the Racquet and Tennis Club since 1983. To mark the centenary of the Club's occupancy of its Park Avenue building in 2018, Howard photographed the building's façade and interiors in color and black-and-white using a circa 1950s Burke & James 8 x 10-inch view camera. His process is more fully described on the final page of <emph render="italic">Racquet and Tennis Club, 1918-2018</emph> (Volume 1 in the container list, below). For more on Howard, visit his website at <extref actuate="onRequest" href="http://philipkhoward.com/">philipkhoward.com</extref>.

The collection consists of a portfolio of twenty-seven 16 x 20-inch archivally printed photographs by Philip Howard of the exterior and interiors of the Racquet and Tennis Club at 370 Park Avenue, a McKim, Mead & White-designed building constructed 1916-1918. Also included is a book of the same photographs, with 14 additional views—<emph render="italic">Racquet and Tennis Club, 1918-2018</emph>—issued for the centenary of the organization's occupancy of the building.

subject.value: Tennis clubs -- New York (State)  -- New York

Book | Racquet and Tennis Club, 1918-201820181 (of 1)1Scope and Contents

Commemorative book issued for the centenary of the Racquet and Tennis Club's building at 370 Park Avenue, with an introduction by Samuel G. White and 41 color and black-and-white photographs by Philip Howard. The book is unpaginated, so, in the list below, the archivist has supplied bracketed numbers that correspond to each photograph-and-caption's position in the volume.

[01] | Clubhouse, built 1918 [02] | Lobby with WWII Memorial Plaque [03] | Stair to Second floor. Tennis Player (1897) sculpted by Fitzgerald Cornwall Peploe [04] | East Lounge [05] | East Lounge [06] | Eagle, sculptor unknown [07] | Loggia [08] | Dining room, chandeliers from prior clubhouse [09] | Library [10] | Dressing room [11] | East Court, Tennis [12] | Passage to East Court [13] | East Court toward Grille [14] | East Court towards Pell Room [15] | East Court Scorer's Box [16] | East Court panorama [17] | East Court panorama [18] | East Court [19] | Gallery, East Court [20] | Tambour, West Court [21] | Tambour, East Court [22] | East Court from Pell Room [23] | Racquets Court [24] | Gallery, Racquets Court [25] | Racquets Court from Gallery, World Champion James Stout on left [26] | Squash Doubles Court [27] | Squash Doubles Court from gallery [28] | Squash Singles Court No. 3 [29] | Pool [30] | Dry Sauna [31] | The Slab Room [32] | Dressing Room [33] | Dressing Room [34] | Bar, mural by Edwin Austin Abbey [35] | Billiards Room [36] | Billiards Room [37] | Billiards Room, Cue Rack [38] | East Lounge at Christmas [39] | Front Desk [40] | Alley [41] | Club Façade

Portfolio | Archival prints20181 (of 1)2Scope and Contents

Twenty-seven 16 x 20-inch archival prints of Philip Howard's photographs from the book Racquet and Tennis Club, 1918-2018. None of the prints is identified; the captions in the list below are transcribed from the book. The numbers in brackets correspond to each photograph-and-caption's position in the published volume.
